modulesApplication.database.course_leader module¶

class modulesApplication.database.course_leader.CourseLeader(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

A CourseLeader object relates a Person object to a Module object and defines who teaches a module, as well as what term the module is running in.

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.MultipleObjectsReturned

id¶

Auto generated primary key integer. The Meta inner class specifies a unique_together contrainst between the module and person, since Django’s ORM does not officially support composite keys.

leader¶

Whether this CourseLeader is the primary leader of the Module or not.

The related Module object.

The related Person object.

term¶

The term the module runs in - one of TermChoices.

modulesApplication.database.module_selection module¶

class modulesApplication.database.module_selection.ModuleSelection(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

A ModuleSelection is created by a student when they choose their modules.

It specifies information about the student, and has a foreign key reference to their degree program.

A Module can be selected via a_module.selected_in.add(a_module_selection)

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.MultipleObjectsReturned

When the selection was last modified.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>¶

The stage of the student’s degree.

The status of the selection - e.g., approved, pending, .etc.

class modulesApplication.database.module_variants.ModuleVariant(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

Bases: django.core.exceptions.MultipleObjectsReturned

id¶

Autogenerated ID in lieue of composite key. Unique_together constraint is defined in the Meta inner class between the major/minor modules.

minor¶

Foreign key to the minor module - e.g. CS2815 is a variant of CS2810.

class modulesApplication.database.option_rule.OptionRule(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

A class to represent OptionRules. When a student makes a selection, the modules they are allowed to pick is defined by several OptionRule objects.

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.ObjectDoesNotExist

Bases: django.core.exceptions.MultipleObjectsReturned

get_constraint_type_display(*, field=<django.db.models.fields.CharField: constraint_type>)¶
id¶

Auto-generated ID.

max_quantity¶

Defines the maximum number of modules matching this OptionRule’s mod_code_pattern to be selected.

min_quantity¶

Defines the minimum number of modules matching this OptionRule’s mod_code_pattern to be selected.

mod_code_pattern¶

A comma-separated string listing one or several mod_codes defining what modules this rule applies to.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>¶
prog_code¶

ForeignKey to the Programme this rule is for.

save(force_insert=False, force_update=False, using=None, update_fields=None)¶

Override to validatee the constraint type upon saving. Useful for csv imports.

static squash_core_modules(programme, entry_year, stage)¶

A static method to “squash” all of the core option rules for a given programme, entry year and stage into one single core option rule. It moves all mod_codes from multiple CORE rules for this programme/entry_year/stage into one single rule, and deletes the redundant rules from the database.

This means instead of having multiple CORE option rule per core module for each case, we can instead have one CORE option rule containing all of the modules in the rule’s mod_code.

Parameters

  • programme – the Programme object who’s core modules you wish to squash

  • entry_year – the entry year of the programme

  • stage – the stage of the programme who’s core modules you wish to squash

Returns: True if all modules are squashed successfully

stage¶

The stage this applies to.

modulesApplication.database.people module¶

class modulesApplication.database.people.People(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

A class to represent a person, i.e, a member of the faculty.

It is referenced by the CourseLeader class to link instructors to the modules they instruct.

This corresponds to the ‘people’ table in the sqlite3 database.

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.ObjectDoesNotExist

class modulesApplication.database.programme.Programme(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

A data model representing a degree program, eg ‘BSc Computer Science’.

This is very much simplified in comparison to the equivalent model in the example database, as we simply don’t need most of those fields for our purposes.

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.ObjectDoesNotExist

class modulesApplication.database.strand.Strands(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

Some modules may be on strands, e.g., CS2815 is on the Software Engineering strand. This relates modules to their strands if they should have one.

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.MultipleObjectsReturned

clean(*args, **kwargs)¶

Hook for doing any extra model-wide validation after clean() has been called on every field by self.clean_fields. Any ValidationError raised by this method will not be associated with a particular field; it will have a special-case association with the field defined by NON_FIELD_ERRORS.

get_strand_display(*, field=<django.db.models.fields.CharField: strand>)¶
module¶

Foreign key to the corresponding Module.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>¶
save(*args, **kwargs)¶

Save the current instance. Override this in a subclass if you want to control the saving process.

The ‘force_insert’ and ‘force_update’ parameters can be used to insist that the “save” must be an SQL insert or update (or equivalent for non-SQL backends), respectively. Normally, they should not be set.

strand¶

The strand - one of StrandChoices.

strand_id¶

Auto-generated ID. The Meta subclass specifies a unique_together constraint between the module and strand, as Django’s ORM does not support composite keys.

modulesApplication.database.student_profile module¶

class modulesApplication.database.student_profile.StudentProfile(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

A database model to cache student information drawn from LDAP, avoiding repeat queries to the LDAP server each time we need this information.

This is updated by LDAP each time a student logs in.

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.MultipleObjectsReturned

entry_year¶

The year they began their studies.

id¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>¶
static populate_student_profile_from_ldap(user, student_id, entry_year, prog_code)¶

Populates this profile given the user object, their student ID, entry_year and programme code, drawn from LDAP on login.

prog_code¶

String of student’s programme code. May be null if LDAP entry is incorrect, e.g. there are two.

stage¶

The student’s degree stage. Calculated on login.

student_id¶

The student’s ID.

user¶

The Django User object.
